alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Gadsden; Inland Gulf; Liberty (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 3:08PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Gulf and Calhoun Counties in the Panhandle of Florida, western Gadsden and northern Liberty Counties in Big Bend of Florida through 400 PM EDT/300 PM CDT/... At 307 PM EDT/207 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of Greensboro to near Stonemill Creek. Movement was north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Blountstown, Greensboro, Stonemill Creek, Chattahoochee, Orange, Wewahitchka, Bristol, Rock Bluff, Clarksville, Ocheesee, Juniper, Selman, Abe Springs, Chipola Cutoff, Hosford, Jensen Place, Rosedale, Chipola, Red Hill and Clio. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
